nodes.text:
Activation of Polystyrene Surface 
  


The wells of a polystyrene microtiter plate were loaded with FNAB \(10 µmol/50 µl methanol/well), allowed to air dry in the dark in a fume hood to get FNAB coated polymer surface.  FNAB coated polymer was then exposed to UV light at a wavelength of 365 nm for 20 min. The wells were washed thrice by ethanol followed by methanol. The activated plates were dried and used further for enzyme \(biomolecule) immobilization.

slots.value: wells of a polystyrene microtiter plate
allowed to air dry in the dark in a fume hood to get FNAB coated polymer surface

nodes.text:
Activation of Polystyrene Surface 
  


The wells of a polystyrene microtiter plate were loaded with FNAB \(10 µmol/50 µl methanol/well), allowed to air dry in the dark in a fume hood to get FNAB coated polymer surface.  FNAB coated polymer was then exposed to UV light at a wavelength of 365 nm for 20 min. The wells were washed thrice by ethanol followed by methanol. The activated plates were dried and used further for enzyme \(biomolecule) immobilization.

Optimization of incubation time for immobilisation of HRP on the Activated Polystyrene Surface
  


A stock solution of HRP was made in PBS \(pH 7.2, 0.01 M). Different amounts of HRP \(0–15 µg/well) were loaded into FNAB treated as well as untreated polystyrene wells and the final volume of each well was made up to 300 µl by adding buffer.
